column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: 61 of our small mobile assets (cranes, container handlers, forklifts, mobile plants, etc.) have been converted to electric. Six weeks Trial of 75T ITV at Bell Bay in TAS showed potential to reduce CO2e emissions. The successful trial has resulted in QUBE Holdings exploring solutions in other QUBE Holdings operations.
column20: Electric Asset Conversion, CO2e Emission Reduction, Sustainability Measures

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: Electric triple road train trial in partnership with OZ Minerals and Janus Electric in South Australia, with a range of 400km on a single charge. More efficient premium grade diesel at all available locations will drive further 3% to 4% efficiency improvements.
column20: Electric Triple Road Train Trial, Efficiency Improvements, Sustainable Practices

column6: Emissions of ozone-depleting substances (ODS)
Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column7: We recognise the importance of responsible waste management in minimising our environmental impact. We are committed to implementing effective waste management practices throughout our operations and supply chain.

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: Improved data collection will also enable the consolidation of waste management services and more meaningful engagement with our suppliers to promote sustainable waste management practices throughout the supply chain. We currently collect operational waste data for four different waste streams to measure the effectiveness of waste minimisation initiatives, monitor trends, provide visibility and identify further improvement opportunities.
column20: Waste Management, Recycling Initiatives, Supply Chain Sustainability

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: In FY23, we consolidated our waste management services for our Logistics operations in Queensland and Victoria and conducted waste audits across several sites. Based on the findings of these audits, we developed action plans. We implemented initiatives that resulted in diverting 17 per cent of our waste from landfills and saw 250 tonnes of cardboard and 45 tonnes of timber be recycled.
column20: Waste Reduction, Waste Audits, Recycling Programs

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: In New Zealand, our ISO team currently recycle around 9.5 tonnes of waste bark generated through debarking operations, and a tyre re-tread program has commenced. Work is also underway to reduce, recycle and re-purpose waste generated throughout the supply chain.
column20: Environmental Standards, ISO14001 Compliance, Sustainability Practices

column6: Waste generated
column7: 1% Recycled, 9% General Waste, 40% Scrap, 50% Controlled Contaminated Waste

column6: Waste diverted from disposal
column7: In FY23, we recycled 1 per cent of our waste. In FY24, we will expand our operational waste management audit program to improve our waste management practices, identify waste reduction opportunities, and increase our recycling rate.

column6: Waste directed to disposal
Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
column13: As part of our Health, Safety, and Sustainability management system, we have implemented environmental standards, practices and procedures to identify and manage our material environmental risks. Our major QUBE Holdings Ports and Bulk facilities now comply with ISO14001 ecological standards. Work is underway to achieve certifications for the remainder of our Ports, Bulk and Logistics sites.
column20: ISO14001 Certification, Environmental Standards, Sustainability Practices

column6: New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria

column8: QUBE Holdings Thrive Awards Ã¢ÂÂ Ã¢ÂÂThe QubiesÃ¢ÂÂ
column13: In FY23, we launched our inaugural Thrive Awards, dubbed 'The Qubies'. These awards are open to team members from all roles, all sites and all levels in our business and will recognise, celebrate and reward our teammates who live and breathe our values.
column20: Employee Recognition, Awards Program, Organizational Values

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: The cadet program is a 12-month structured opportunity where cadets undertake two rotations within the business and gain experience across the QUBE Holdings Group. It is embedded in our strategic talent and capability development strategy.
column20: Talent Development, Cadet Program, Skill Building

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Throughout the year, we expanded our recruitment activities to include additional social media platforms - Facebook, LinkedIn and Instagram - and activated additional recruitment platforms to provide us with direct access to school leavers and graduate students. CareerHub is a centralised platform that allows QUBE Holdings to post jobs to one central site, with the ability to reach out to millions of students and recent graduates at 36 universities across Australia. At the same time, Explore Careers is Australia's largest early-career and employment platform focused on giving young people the best possible tools, resources, advice, guidance and opportunities.
column20: Recruitment Strategies, Social Media, Career Development

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
Parental leave
column13: Under this new policy, eligible employees are entitled to 12 weeks of paid parental leave Ã¢ÂÂ up from a previous base of six weeks (plus one week per year of service). In addition, QUBE Holdings will pay superannuation payments on both an employee's period of QUBE Holdings-paid parental leave and any government-paid parental leave (where an employee is eligible), helping to address the superannuation gender pay gap.
column20: Parental Leave Policy, Gender Pay Gap, Employee Benefits

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column7: Termination Notice Period for the Executive KMP: 6 months. Other than for gross misconducCompanyrmination payment instead of notice is payable upon early termination by the Company.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: In FY23, we continued to adopt a "safety differently" approach. "Safety differently" is about relying on the expertise and insights of our frontline workforce in terms of how work is done to recalibrate our approach and improve safety and efficiency.
column20: Safety Culture, Safety Improvement, Frontline Engagement

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Our Critical Risk (CR) program enables QUBE Holdings to verify that we have the required critical controls for work tasks with associated fatality risks. A vital aspect of the program is ensuring that frontline workers are engaged in completing control verifications by managers and supervisors. In FY23, we strengthened this requirement with a leading KPI for senior leaders: "Critical Risk Review with Worker Involvement".\t
column20: Critical Risk Management, Safety Verification, Worker Engagement

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: QUBE Holdings's new integrated management system, INX, is designed to help future-proof our workforce and business by addressing three critical compliance and legislative requirements: Event management, Learning management system, and Health reporting. By creating an integrated SHS program, we have observed several positive outcomes throughout FY23, including reduced bottlenecks in information flow, improved data security and visibility, enabling better, data-driven decision making and improved efficiencies from eliminating manual processes.
column20: Integrated Management System, Compliance, Data-driven Decision Making

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: QUBE Holdings Critical Management Model explains steps taken to understand risks. It consists of: 1. Identify Critical Risks 2. Identify Controls 3. Define Performance & Reporting Criteria. 4. Verify - Gain Worker Insights. 5. Report.\t

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: In FY22, QUBE Holdings developed the international Due Diligence Index Ã¢ÂÂ Safety (DDI-S) board health and safety performance reporting tool. The tool has been created through an open collaboration between Clyde & Co, Professor Sidney Dekker, Art of Work and several pilot participants, including health and safety professionals from QUBE Holdings, Hansen Yuncken, Transgrid, Serco, QUU, Brisbane Airport Corporation and Aurizon. We continued to support the DDI-S index in FY23 by sharing the lessons we have learned through our partnership with the safety community to inform the development of a new Standard.\t
column20: Safety Performance Metrics, DDI-S Index, Safety Standards

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Psychosocial hazards and risk were also key focus areas at our FY23 Safety, Health and Sustainability (SHS) Conference. Each year, SHS team members from across Australia and New Zealand come together to drive the Agenda of the Group's overall SHS strategy, give valuable input to emerging trends and lived experiences at a site level, and learn from industry experts who partner with QUBE Holdings in establishing meaningful and deliverable outcomes for our team.
column20: Psychosocial hazards, risk, safety and health

column6: Occupational health services
column13: While we strive for Zero Harm, injuries do happen, and we know that recovery time can be significantly impacted by the time taken to confirm the diagnosis and commence treatment. That's why we have adopted the 'athletes model' for injury management and implemented our 'Report for Support' program. Report for support provides our employees with immediate access to a dedicated injury management team to assess and triage a worker's injury as soon as it's reported.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: This year, in the lead-up to the busy pre-Christmas period, our Stop for Safety campaign was built around the theme "Look up. Look out". The campaign reminded our people to be aware of their surroundings, to ensure they were away from the line of fire, to remain vigilant and always to maintain sight of the importance of putting health and safety first. QUBE Holdings commissioned a special edition pair of Wayfarer-style sunglasses, stamped with the "Look up, Look out" message, for every employee as part of the campaign.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
Promotion of worker health
